page.title: 13Wildlife
page.content: There are not any wildlife parks in the area but at least there is some grass and fields. For instance there is the marlhole. There are many animals there but you do not see them often. There are birds, mice, rabbits,snakes and many insects. There are two big ponds in the southern part of Apedale where a few swans paddle. Many types of birds were seen during our observations, the most common being wood pigeon, lapwing, skylark, swallow and magpie. There was also evidence of foxes, badgers, and rabbits in the area. The rural part of the area is criss-crossed by many public footpaths, but many stiles must be negotiated.
